title: Marathon Bombing Trial Heads for Closing Arguments
teaser: The defense rested its case yesterday, just a day after it called its first witness. WBUR's David Boeri reports.
contentencoded:
After 16 days of testimony, the federal trial of admitted Boston Marathon bomber Dzhokhar Tsarnaev will resume on Monday with closing arguments. The defense rested its case yesterday, just a day after it called its first witness. David Boeri of Here & Now contributor station WBUR reports.

  • WBUR’s Coverage of the Dzhokhar Tsarnaev Trial
  • “Finish Line” podcast: featuring analysis from WBUR’s David Boeri and Boston Globe columnist Kevin Cullen.
